captions.text: [ Buzzing ]

Howdy.
Howdy to you.

Beautiful evenin'.
Yeah.

Sure wanna thankyou for
comin' all the way up here
to see me...

from that
nice hotel downtown.

No problem.
What's on your mind ?

Well, now, here's a man
who wants to get
right down to it.

Kinda anxious
to get to it, are ya ?
Whatever.
A man's attitude--

A man's attitude
goes some ways...

to the way
his life will be.

ls that something
you might agree with ?
Sure.
Now, did you answer...

because that's whatyou thought
l wanted to hear,

or did you think about
what l said...

and answer 'cause
you truly believe that
to be right ?

l agree with whatyou said.
Truly.
What'd l say ?

That a man's attitude
determines, to a large extent,
how his life will be.
So sinceyou agree,

you must be a person
who does not care
about the good life.
How's that ?

Well, stop for a little second
and think about it.
Can you do that for me ?
[ Chuckles ]
Okay, l'm thinkin'.
No, you're not thinkin'.

You're too busy
bein' a smart aleck
to be thinkin'.

Now, l wantyou to think
and stop bein' a smart aleck.
Can you ty that for me ?

Look, where's this going ?
What doyou want me to do ?
There's sometimes a buggy.

How many drivers
does a buggy have ?
One.

So let'sjust say
l'm drivin' this buggy,

and ifyou fixyour attitude,
you can ride along with me.
Okay.

l wantyou to go back
to work tomorrow.

You were recasting
the lead actress anyway.

Audition many girls
for the part.

Whenyou see the girl that was
shown toyou eartier today,
_ou witt say,

The rest ofthe cast
can stay.
That's up to_ou.

But that lead girl
is not up to you.

Now, _ou witt see me
o_e more time...

Now, _ou witt see me
o_e more time...
ifyou do good.

You'll see me
two more times...
ifyou do bad.
Good night.

title: Mulholland Dr. (6/10) Movie CLIP - The Cowboy (2001) HD

comments.text:
A bizarre footnote: there are a handful of UFO/high strange 
abduction-missing time reports that involve a cowboy "screen memory", that 
is, the experiencer consciously remembered seeing a cowboy then discovered 
the "aliens" under hypnosis. In each case the "abductee" reported the 
cowboy's hat was white with a too-large brim. ﻿

comments.author: zackhanscom

comments.text:
There is something undeniably creepy about the Cowboy character in this 
scene.  He starts off being very polite, even engaging in pleasantries like 
"beautiful evening," but it is obvious that he's in charge---driving the 
buggy, as it were---and when the other guy gives him attitude his tone 
changes and he becomes brutally direct in his language.  I'm not sure why 
exactly but this is one of the most memorable scenes in cinema; once you've 
seen it you can never forget it.﻿
comments.author: JackKangaroo1

comments.text:
Lynch usually deals with his greatest fears, in this case, he's exposing 
the very real fear of having his art hijacked by hollywood, ie the mention 
of the DUNE buggie, I think Lynch felt like he wasn't in the driver's seat 
on that ride.  ﻿

comments.text:
Dune is one of the greatest regrets of his life. The longer version isn't a

comments.text:
Most people see this film as worthless, pointless and with out sense. Those 
are the brainless idiots who did not get the director's point. The director 
wanted his audience to think and analyze, even though you watch it over and 
over again. The cool thing about it though, is once you have uncovered one 
or two mysteries out of the movie, there will be one more mystery for you 
to uncover every time you watch it, even if you only turn it on like once a 
year. I just uncovered a new mystery, even though I deemed the mystery if 
the movie completely solved.﻿
comments.author: Bathory187

comments.text:
I've come to the conclusion that he's a sort of hero character that Diane 
has conjured up. He challenges Adam's ideals here but later on at the 
dinner party which takes place in reality, we see him again as Diane looks 
away from the table. Here, he can't get involved though despite Diane 
wanting him to because this takes place in the real world. It's all down to 
her wanting things to be a certain way but ultimately what she wants is 
impossible and that torments her to no end.
comments.author: 2012INC

comments.author: mark musich

comments.text:
We, the audience, see the cowboy again twice (on Diane's "waking" and at 
the party on Mulholland Drive). The cowboy is God, reminding us, the 
audience, that we "do not care about the good life." We "do bad" - meaning 
we are estranged from God (biblical). Our redemption comes from recognizing 
this fact, from making the "good life" again the focus of our being. For 
Diane and Adam, who "do good", and only see the cowboy one more time, no 
such grace is given. bartleby [dot] com/102/128 [dot] html
comments.author: HellenicDigital

comments.author: Maafa 1619

comments.text:
Agree with you, for all the same reasons. It felt like a twisted Wizard of 
Oz. There are some great scenes in this movie, but I remember being pretty 
disappointed by it when I first saw it. I'm watching it now again years 
later, but I'm not enjoying it anymore than the first time. Personally I 
think Lynch's best movie will always be Blue Velvet. This one just did not 
click with me.
comments.author: Scott Fairbanks

comments.text:
Betty had camilla killed due to jealousy. The box represents betty's guilt. 
Betty has a fantasy where the people populating her real world become 
characters in her idealized world. She ends up going insane from guilt and 
kills herself. The end. Or it could be a poorly actualized movie built from 
pieces of a television show that wasn't to be. Good acting, good 
cinematography, good set design and locations, good make-up and costuming. 
Bad storytelling, bad writing, bad editing. Mediocre film.
comments.author: dj kerry

comments.text:

Creo que es una representacion visual de su propia consciencia. En el fondo 
sabe que el no controla el casting (no conduce el buggy) con lo que aunque 
le cueste debe aceptarlo. La luz se enciende y se apaga, es un momento de 
claridad. Aunque por supuesto se podria interpretar de otra forma... Toda 
la pelicula esta llena de posibles interpretaciones.

comments.text:
The Cowboy is a representation of old Hollywood... whose most popular genre 
was the Western. The literal definition of a Cowboy is "one who herds 
cattle". So in this case, The Cowboy was sent to herd Adam... just another 
cow who is ultimately controlled by The Illuminati - the Cowboys of 
Hollywood. Also notice Adam's facial expression as the Cowboy walks away 
and "vanishes"... is the Cowboy real or an apparition?

movies.
